parameters.definition: Number of Popsicle sticks required for a beam bridge
Units of glue required for a beam bridge
Number of Popsicle sticks required for a truss bridge
Units of glue required for a truss bridge
Mass supported by a beam bridge
Mass supported by a truss bridge

description: An engineering school has a bridge building competition where students must build as many beam bridges and truss bridges as they can using Popsicle sticks and glue. A beam bridge requires \param{PopsicleBeam} Popsicle sticks and \param{GlueBeam} units of glue while a truss bridge requires \param{PopsicleTruss} Popsicle sticks and \param{GlueTruss} units of glue. Each team has at most \param{TotalPopsicles} Popsicle sticks and \param{TotalGlue} units of glue. In addition, each team can build at most \param{MaxTruss} truss bridges and the number of beam bridges must be larger than the number of truss bridges. If a beam bridge can hold \param{MassBeam} grams and a truss bridge can hold \param{MassTruss} grams, how many of each bridge should a team build to maximize the total mass that can be supported?
